review_blob: I dont know about this one. Its a bit simple. I appreciate the intensity of the hops, but even I want a little more balance and complexity. And Im a hop head.
beer_name: Pipeworks Something Hoppy This Way Comes

review_blob: I found this a bit too sweet for my liking. If Im looking to OD on hops, I dont want all the malty-ness. Thats just me.
beer_name: Moylans Hopsickle Imperial India Pale Ale

review_blob: UPDATED: FEB 16, 2013
There is nothing I can say that hasnt been said about this marvel of hops. Thanks, Founders!
Well, its not my favorite from Three Floyds but I wouldnt kick it out of bed.
Exceptional. Not my preferred style but I fell in love with this one. Perfectly balanced caramel and resin flavors. Beautiful dry finish.
beer_name: Flossmoor Station Bourbon Barrel-Aged Hi-Fi Rye Wine

review_blob: The spices are too mild for my tastes in this one. Comes across as a bit watered down.
Not my favorite Elysian beer but in my eyes, they can do no wrong. So maybe I am biased. I think its a solid APA. Not exceptional but solid.
Just the right level of spice and earthiness. Its not often that I chose to drink a saison over an i.p.a. but this was my pick over Revolutions Anti-Hero.
Had on tap during its first week. You know how I feel about a well-balanced DIPA.
Lovely, well balanced and somewhat light weight for its style. Just wish we could get it in the Midwest...

Yea, I dunno. Definitely not my favorite Dogfish Head brew, though also not my preferred style. But I think that the concept of this beer is better than the execution. Slightly overhyped. Beautiful label work though.

Note: Its a beer, but....well, not really. Its almost like a shandy but still not quite. Whatever it is, it sure hits the spot while taking a lovely stroll in Parc Guel. I guess sometimes the memories we associate a beer with affect the taste buds, no?

beer_brewer_name: Grumpy Troll Brewery, Restaurant and Pizzeria
review_blob: I likes what I likes, and to me jasmine and beer are a match made in heaven. Ginger pulls it all together. Delicious.

beer_brewer_name: Grumpy Troll Brewery, Restaurant and Pizzeria
review_blob: I appreciate risk-taking in beer and I think that this one paid off. Could have been a tad spicier but the jalapeno flavor distinctly comes through.
beer_name: Grumpy Troll Slow Eddie Jalapeno Ale

review_blob: If you are not a fan of floral flavors, you will not enjoy this beer. I am however,  which is why its one of my faves. So unique and quite well balanced in my opinion. If only they could ship outside of Washington....sigh
I love me some hops but the name is appropriate. I shouldnt expect more complexity from a palate wrecker. Still rated highly for the hops alone.
Surprisingly light and refreshing which is appropriate for a Brazilian beer. Not bad.
Almost perfect! A very promising start for this new beer company. Hope that they keep it up!
beer_name: Pipeworks Ninja vs. Unicorn Double IPA

review_blob: A little too syrupy for my taste. Plenty of hops but not much complexity. Wouldnt be my first choice but does the trick.
A little disappointing considering the standard held to these two breweries. I mean, not bad but not as good as it could have been. A bit light-handed in flavor.
Wow. Another brilliant beer from the folks at FW. Well balanced with rye, resiny hops and notes of leather. Delicious.
beer_name: Firestone Walker Wookey Jack Black Rye IPA

review_blob: Impressive flavor profiles for an extremely hoppy yet low alcohol beer. All Day is such an appropriate name as you can drink them all day without getting completely wasted.
UPDATED: AUG 20, 2012

I cant believe that no one has mentioned the notes of chive or garlic sprouts! That is what strikes me first. Of all the hop-heavy beers Ive had, this is the only one thats had this flavor, even those with a pine or resin quality. So unique. Love it.
